definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

sentences.english: In former times, people used to fight with swords.
sentences.chinese: 過去，人們慣常用刀劍作戰。

sentences.english: Around the sword light quickly gathered, the sword is pointing at me.
sentences.chinese: 四周的劍光又迅速聚來，刀劍皆指向我。

sentences.english: Many words cut (hurt) more than swords.
The pen is mightier than the sword.
He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 並將他的百姓交與刀劍，向他的產業發怒。

sentences.english: And he that passeth over from justice to sin, God hath prepared such an one for the sword.
sentences.chinese: 離棄正義而偏向罪惡的人，上主爲他準備了刀劍。

sentences.english: Most Oni dress in tighter skins and wield huge swords.
sentences.chinese: 黑鬼長有硬皮，揮舞巨大的刀劍。

sentences.english: Sometimes words hurt more than swords.
sentences.chinese: 惡語有時傷人比刀劍更厲害。

sentences.english: You have turned back the edge of his sword and have not supported him in battle.
sentences.chinese: 你叫他的刀劍捲刃，叫他在爭戰之中站立不住。

sentences.english: For the battle was there scattered over the face of all the country: and the wood devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.
sentences.chinese: 因爲在那裏四面打仗，死於樹林的比死於刀劍的更多。

sentences.english: Throats are soft to invite the blade.
sentences.chinese: 喉嚨太軟，無法挑戰刀劍。

sentences.english: We gat our bread with the peril of our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 因爲曠野的刀劍，我們冒着險才得糧食。

sentences.english: Nie, a killing machine, finally learns to lay down her sword.
sentences.chinese: 聶隱娘曾經是一個殺人機器，最終卻學會了放下刀劍。

sentences.english: The Sultan's men are coming, with swords in their hands.
sentences.chinese: 蘇丹的武士們來了，手裏都拿着刀劍。

sentences.english: Brandishing their swords,they rode into battle.
sentences.chinese: 他們揮舞着刀劍，策馬進入戰場。

definition: to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
(of family members) separated from one another/scattered about/dispersed/(math.) discrete
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
